comments:
I am unable to run a Runtime-workbench.  I get the following error in the .log:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 06, 2004 09:55:39.964
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of 
boot plug-in or specify -boot.
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.searchForBoot(Main.java:486)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:456)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:289)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:767)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:601)

I cannot reproduce the problem with a fresh workspace.

Which build is this, Sonia?

This is usually caused by a problem in the install.

>I cannot reproduce the problem with a fresh workspace.

Are you sure you are using the same install location? If you are using exactly
the same install, I would expect this problem to happen regardless the workspace
location.
This is build 200402050800 (I20040205).  I am using the same install.

Sonia's problem was an outdated org.eclipse.platform in her workspace. I didn't
notice her problem was when launching Eclipse from Eclipse (a Runtime
workbench), not launching an Eclipse install (as if the summary line wasn't
clear enough).

traces.message: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of  boot plug-in or specify -boot.
